page.title: 19THE SWAN,NEAR COLD ASHTON.
page.content: The Swan is a small{pub}in the hamlet of Pennsylvania, with associations going back 700 years.. There is no residential{accomodation,}travellers have to use bed and breakfast at farms or in Cold Ashton.There is a very old fire places and collections of coins and horse brasses. {Trade}is local and regular in the evening, passing at lunch time.There is a good bar{menu}- steak and chips Â£5.95, chicken and chips Â£2.90, ploughman's (bread and cheese)Â£1.45, etc.,for sweets, gateau, apple pie or icecream. The customers have recently raised Â£600 for{Muscular Dystrophy}appeal by a 3 legged race, fancy dress and dart competitions.A folk night with singer and guitar is held fortnightly. The most popular{drinks}are whisky (65p) and real ale (80p).
